header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: The text posits that by understanding the reciprocal relationship between the physical body, its environment, and the underlying spiritual essence, and by consciously employing creative imagination through the lens of Tarot symbolism, individuals can develop supersensory powers and achieve a higher state of cosmic consciousness, ultimately realizing their divine heritage.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 17: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson, as part of a series on developing supersensory powers through Tarot, focuses on the concept of the physical body as a collection of environmental substance, the role of creative imagination in shaping consciousness, and the profound connection to the 'Cosmic Mother' as a representation of the divine feminine principle and the source of life. It explores the embryonic experience as a precursor to cosmic consciousness and emphasizes the importance of reframing the relationship with the physical mother as a channel for divine creation to empower creative imagination and realize one's divine child status.

key_concepts.definition: The physical body is not static but continuously collects and reabsorbs substance from its environment. This process shapes the body and influences emotions. In old age, this substance begins to withdraw, leading to dissolution.
Identified as the 'magic' through which supersensory powers are developed, particularly when guided by Tarot Keys. It is the active force that shapes reality and consciousness.

Life and death, as experienced on the physical plane, are seen as slow-motion processes of consciousness. Recognizing this relativity allows for a shift in self-identification away from the personality and towards the true spiritual self.

The divine feminine principle, the universal womb of God, which gives birth to aspects of itself, such as human individuality. The physical mother is seen as a microcosm or channel for this principle. This concept is also linked to the embryonic experience of bliss and security.

The realization and feeling of being a direct child of God. This concept is central to developing creative imagination and supersensory powers, requiring a shift from abstract understanding to vital, felt knowledge.
The state of pre-birth bliss, peace, love, and security in the amniotic fluid is analogous to a state of cosmic consciousness and a yearning for return to this state of rapture.

Serve as a medium and guiding principle for developing creative imagination and supersensory powers. Their symbolism is seen as potent suggestions to the subconscious and a means of attunement with their creators.

practical_system.description: The system presented aims to develop supersensory powers and higher consciousness through the conscious application of creative imagination, informed by the symbolism of the Tarot. It emphasizes the interconnectedness of the physical body, environment, and spiritual essence, and posits that realizing one's identity as a child of God is key to unlocking creative and magical potential. The process involves a psychological reframing of one's origins (especially the relationship with the physical mother) and a consistent engagement with powerful mental imagery, guided by specific Tarot Keys.
tools: Tarot Keys (specifically mentioned: The Magician, The Empress)
The concept of the 'Cosmic Mother' as a guiding archetype and source of energy
The concept of being a 'child of God' as a core belief to be integrated
rituals: Visualizing the Empress Tarot Key above the head, associating its colors (green, wheat, water) with the throat center and Venus. Mentally 'planting' a creative thought as a seed in the earth, watering it with 'water from the pool' (representing universal consciousness). Holding the feeling of connection to the desired personality manifestation, building a flame of green light, and releasing it to the subconscious. This exercise is to be performed one or two times daily.

The affirmation: 'I am a child of Divinity. As a manifested vehicle inherits traits from its generic strain, so do I, as child of the Most High, inherit the powers of my cosmic parents. I send you my love, physical mother of mine, for being an aspect of the Divine--for lending your substance to grow me. And thus do I clear the channels for the full and spiritual knowledge of my Divine heredity. Sanctified in the love of thee, Cosmic Mother, let me now awaken to the full knowledge of my wondrous heritage.'

relevant_quotes.text: Although the physical body has a good deal to do with what kind of emotions we have, as modern psychology has shown, it is not the body that causes the emotions. Emotional response is carried in the image of the self, which incorporates the emotional matrix.

Use your imagination, work with your creative imagination, and you will see yourselves differently. This is necessary in order to prepare you for the magic we shall develop with the rest of the Tarot Keys. Creative imagination is the magic we use, but through the medium of the Magician, the attention!

Think of yourselves in this way. It is the same slow motion of life and death through incarnations that makes you interpret them in a certain way. If you could see that you are merely experiencing yourself in a slow motion world, you would begin to realize the relativity of manifestation, and to open your consciousness to experience the reality of who and what you really are. You will stop identifying yourself with the personality element that impinges upon the physical body.

You must think of your mother as the outer channel of expression through which God created you, looking upon that individuality whose body was used with gratitude, whether the relationship was tragic or wonderful. In this way you will give your subconsciousness the most potent suggestion possible to increase the power of your creative imagination. You will place in your own bay of subconsciousness a basic idea that, completely expanded, gives you a power of creation equal to that of the Divine Will.

You have heard this statement, "I am a child of God," but has it been just a concept to you? Anything which remains just an abstract concept, though having its place, cannot have a practical effect. It is possible to make this concept more concrete, to give yourself more vital imagery. What could be more effective in helping you to develop yourself towards the experience of feeling and knowing your kinship with God than realizing that you are an actual, not a symbolic, child of God just as you are the actual child of your physical parents?

Definite, clear and sharply delineated imagery is essential to bring you that experience. Use this Tarot Key. Remember, whenever you use any of the Tarot Keys in accordance with the principles that it suggests, you are making suggestions to your subconsciousness in the most potent forms that exist, as well as attuning yourself magnetically to those who not only created these Keys, but who keep sending their messages through the universal symbolism of the Keys.

It is what you think yourself to be that brings your experiences. If you think that you are worthless (or worthy), this is what you will become, this is what your environment will reflect. We are not a body alone; we are our environment, for our environment takes from us, and we give back to it.

critical_analysis.relevance: This lesson is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot as a system for spiritual and psychic development beyond simple divination. It builds upon foundational occult concepts of the subtle body, energetic systems, and the power of consciousness, offering a framework for integrating these with psychological understanding. The emphasis on creative imagination aligns with modern magical practices like Chaos Magic, while the concept of the Cosmic Mother and divine heritage connects to Hermetic and Gnostic traditions. The text positions itself as an advanced extension of standard teachings, likely drawing from systems that integrate Qabalistic, Hermetic, and Tarot-based magical practices, possibly relating to the 'Psychic Training' courses of figures like Dr. Case mentioned.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience comprises students of esoteric and occult studies, specifically those engaged in practical magical work with the Tarot. It assumes a foundational understanding of concepts like spiritual development, consciousness, and possibly the basic symbolism of Tarot. Advanced practitioners seeking to deepen their understanding of creative imagination, psychic development, and the relationship between the physical and spiritual realms would find this text particularly beneficial. It is aimed at individuals ready to move beyond conceptual knowledge to experiential realization of their divine nature and potential.
